meanings.definition: relating to the study of friction, wear, and lubrication
meanings.sent1: The tribological properties of the material affect its durability.
meanings.sent2: Engineers use tribological analysis to improve machine efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The tribological dance between the gears and the oil was quite a sight!
meanings.sent4: In the world of mechanics, tribological harmony is key to smooth operation.
meanings.sent5: Understanding tribological principles can help prevent machinery breakdowns.

meanings.definition: the science and technology of interacting surfaces in relative motion
meanings.sent1: Tribological research aims to enhance the performance of moving parts.
meanings.sent2: The field of tribological engineering is crucial for industrial development.
meanings.sent3: The robot's tribological expertise made it the star of the factory.
meanings.sent4: The ballet dancers moved together with a tribological precision.
meanings.sent5: Exploring the mysteries of tribological interactions can lead to innovative solutions.
